You should be good.  The only problem is if your work or wherever doesnt allow out going connections to port 22 or whatever port you are running your openssh server on!

You should be good to go -- however a few things -- run ssh on a different port like 222 if possible.  You may want to make use of iptables rate-limit command to cut down on the number of false log in attempts, and if you want to get real fancy -- use a port knocker!
others prefer the use of denyhosts or actual modifications of the sshd_conf script itself to specify exact users who can log it.  If you are not explicily listed then you can't log in
the port knockings something i've already on my list. you mean explicitly listed by username?
Yes, or by group
Port knocking is great -- but some consider it heresy -- fwknop is the port knocking utility you want to try however -- its the most advanced and currently is in very active development
